TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE . She lives in GPE , GPE of GPE of GPE .

The applicant receives her old - age pension and certain other social benefits from the social security authorities . At the time when the applicant lodged the application the total amount of the social payments that she received was MONEY per month .

She claimed that from DATE the amount of these benefits had not been properly calculated . In particular , she alleged that during this period she had been entitled to a special benefit as a widow of a Second World War participant , in accordance with a statute of DATE ( see the ‘ Relevant domestic law’ part below ) . She applied to ORG of GPE , claiming pecuniary and non - pecuniary damages in this respect .

On DATE the court dismissed the action on the ground that the applicant had been entitled to the social benefit in question , but that before DATE she had not applied for it in accordance with the procedure established by that law . The court also noted that since DATE the applicant had received the claimed benefit . On DATE ORG of GPE dismissed the applicant ’s appeal against the judgment , finding that the lower court had properly decided the case .
LAW ( Article CARDINAL ) and LAW entitle a person to an old - age pension , the amount of which depends on the employment and related activities record .
The Act of CARDINAL DATE entitles Second World War participants and their widows to additional DATE payments .
